intro: Angorkis cowanii, commonly known as the Cowan's angorkis, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of northern Queensland, Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and aromatic leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
